snippet: “The Avengers” took in about $200.3 million over the weekend, smashing the record for the biggest opening weekend of all time.
abstract: Marvel's The Avengers, action film directed by Joss Whedon, takes in about $200.3 million at North American theaters over the weekend, in a strong start to Hollywood's summer movie season; ticket sales beat record set in summer 2011 by the movie Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2 for the biggest opening weekend of all time. Photo (M)2
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES -- Sorry, Harry. ''The Avengers'' have crushed you. In a strong start to Hollywood's summer movie season the superhero team in ''Marvel's The Avengers'' took in about $200.3 million at North American theaters over the weekend, according to Walt Disney Studios, which released the film. That No. 1 result easily smashed what the movie industry considers the record, set last summer by ''Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2,'' for the biggest opening weekend of all time. Its total was $169.2 million if you don't account for inflation, or about $172 million if you do.

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY HALLOWS: PART 2 (MOVIE)
